content.description: This one looks like it should be easy from the ground as it isn't real steep but the holds are smaller than standard for Hueco.  Make technical moves on small holds to a tricky top out.
content.location: Start on the right side of the face a few feet left of the warmup arete.  Climbs a white scoop on lower angled rock

content.description: Start on a high undercling and make a easy move to an ok crimp.  Here figure out what to do with your feet and figure out how to get to the sharp jug.  From here things get easier but the holds though positive are still small.   Save some energy for the topout which contains more choss than jugs.
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  Might be good to have a spotter on the boulder behind in case you blow the finishing moves.
content.location: On the far left side of the boulder.

content.description: This classic line may be easy if you have enough reach, or extremely challenging if you can't reach the horizontal rail.  Start on a sidepull and jug at 6 ft, make a move into an undercling and make a big reach for the horizontal rail.  The rail is good enough to cut if you need to.  Continue up on a few small crimps to an easier topout.
content.protection: Pads and Spotters, helps to have a spotter up on the boulder behind in case you blow the topout.
content.location: On the left side of the boulder.  Just right of "Nuns and Donkeys".

content.description: Start low on opposing sidepulls.  Make challenging moves on slopey pockets to another tricky move towards the top.  From here things ease off for the topout.  The Wilder guide mentions that this is "A challenge for any V3 climber - V10 climber for that matter."  It held up to it's reputation as I found it just as challenging as the harder lines on the wall.
content.location: In the middle of the wall, right of "Right Donkey Show" and left of the faint crack that is "Beast of Burden".

content.description: This sunny wall makes for a good warmup on cold days when the other more popular areas already have tours at them.  Has a few V0's on the main boulder as well as some even easier stuff on the boulder behind.  After this there are several V3's with the difficulty topping out at V6.  Left Donkey show V5 is the classic of the area.
